Description: ConAgra Foods, Inc. agreed to pay $45 million to settle allegations that it engaged in improper, and in certain instances fraudulent, accounting practices during its fiscal years 1999 through 2001, including the misuse of corporate reserves to manipulate reported earnings in fiscal year 1999 and a scheme at its former subsidiary, United Agri-Products (UAP), in 2000 that involved, among other things, improper and premature revenue recognition.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2007/2007-142.htm

Description: ConAgra Foods, Inc., the owner and operator of a food ingredient and flour mill in Hastings, Minnesota, was sentenced for violating the Clean Water Act. The company was ordered to pay a criminal fine of $138,513 and provide $55,000 in community service to the National Park Foundation as well as $55,000 in community service to the Friends of the Mississippi River.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2006/January/06_enrd_024.html

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. Description: ConAgra Grocery Products LLC, a subsidiary of ConAgra Foods Inc., agreed to plead guilty and pay $11.2 million -- an $8 million criminal fine and $3.2 million in forfeiture of assets -- in connection with the shipment of contaminated peanut butter linked to a 2006 through 2007 nationwide outbreak of salmonella poisoning.
Agency: Food and Drug Administration referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/conagra-subsidiary-agrees-enter-guilty-plea-connection-2006-through-2007-outbreak-salmonella

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the San Joaquin Valley Air Pollution Control District announced a Clean Air Act settlement with Ralcorp's Cottage Bakery in Lodi, Calif. after the facility failed to obtain permits and install proper air pollution controls. The company agreed to pay a penalty of $625,000 and spend $750,000 to install and operate a thermal oxidizer to reduce volatile organic compound (VOC) emissions by 95 percent.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/54cb8872cf4e52f285257a2900604776.html
